isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - PROGRAMMING - TWO-SPEED DIP SWITCH

svcproc.title: TWO-SPEED DIP SWITCH
svcproc.para: With Mechanical Engines - The two-speed DIP switch provides a means of selecting between two different two-speed axle ratios. The 9200/9300/9400 model series only offers one two-speed ratio, so this switch is always set to zero.

With Electronic Engines - The switch will be set to zero, but two speed applications must be programmed into the engine ECM on some models. Refer to Master Service Manual CTS-5000, 08, 1994 Electronic Engine Controls for additional information on reprogramming two-speed axle effects.
